Hi, I have a question about equation (4):

When I try to compute y[1,1], I notice that there is no pair of indices where both x[1−i,1−j] and h[i,j] exist at the same time, because 1−i and i, or 1−j and j, cannot both be positive simultaneously.

In this situation, how should y[1,1] be computed?
Does the formula assume padding or some other convention outside the boundary of x?

comments.content: I was also a bit confused about this and I'm just assuming the convention for "no padding" is that we only compute convolution where the filter h completely fits inside x. I guess this figure in Lecture note may also kind of indicate that?
